question.text: Which of the following changes in earlier classification systems were not brought about by R.H. Whittaker?

options.text: Blue green algae are no longer considered as plants.
Chlorella, a unicellular alga, is no longer considered as a plant.
Amoeba and Paramoecium are no longer considered as animals.
Yeast, a unicellular eukaryote, is no longer considered as fungus

solution.text: R.H. Whittaker proposed a Five Kingdom Classification in 1969. According to him all unicellular prokaryotic organisms like Bacteria, BGA are included in Kingdom Monera and second kingdom Protista includes all unicellular eukaryotic organisms like Amoeba, Paramecium, etc., kingdom Fungi includes saprophytic, eukaryotic mostly multicellular organisms (except unicellular Saccharomyces cerevisiae). All multicellular organisms whose cell wall is made up of cellulose and pectin and are mostly autotrophic are included in plant kingdom. Kingdom Animalia includes multicellular organisms without cell wall and heterotrophic mode of nutrition.
